posts.post_content:
The most fun thing to do with Phage is imprint her on a [Summoner's Egg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Summoner's Egg) or [Clone Shell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone Shell). Give the card to your opponent somehow ([Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader), [Legerdemain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Legerdemain) -- whatever). Then simply kill the Shell / Egg.
  
   
It's roughly as fun AND reliable as playing your state lottery.
posts.html:
The most fun thing to do with Phage is imprint her on a Summoner's Egg or Clone Shell. Give the card to your opponent somehow (Bazaar Trader, Legerdemain -- whatever). Then simply kill the Shell / Egg.

It's roughly as fun AND reliable as playing your state lottery.

posts.post_content:
"BTW, Karn Liberated's ultimate works with her since she never "enters the battlefield" in that case. "
  
@Paleopaladin: That is flat out wrong. All of the cards exiled with Karn are put into play at the beginning of the game and any triggered abilities will go on the stack at the beginning of the first upkeep.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Maddogliam54  
  
If liliana forces you to discard phage, and then resurrects it, the player who controls it will lose the game. if she uses something that makes all players resurrect their own creatures under their own control, phage's owner will lose the game, not liliana.
posts.html:
@Maddogliam54

If liliana forces you to discard phage, and then resurrects it, the player who controls it will lose the game. if she uses something that makes all players resurrect their own creatures under their own control, phage's owner will lose the game, not liliana.
